alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 09 at 9:27PM PST until December 12 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM SATURDAY TO 4 AM PST MONDAY... * CHANGES...None. * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 feet above 7000 feet with up to 5 feet on the Sierra crest. 8 to 16 inches east of US-395 with 1 to 3 inches through the Chalfant Valley. Winds gusting up to 50 mph with higher gusts through wind prone canyons. Ridgetop gusts over 100 mph. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 7 AM Saturday to 4 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and lead to power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall rates are anticipated Saturday and Sunday. The combination of heavy snow and wind may bring periods near zero visibility in whiteout conditions.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
